DOC.brief_title: Analysis Fel 1-specific T Cells After Airway Allergen Challenge Asthma
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA : 1 ) Male female , age 1865 year . ( 2 ) Asthmatic subject mild allergic asthma . ( 3 ) Positive skin prick test cat allergen wheal diameter least 2mm l. ( 4 ) RAST score least 1 equivalent international units/mL . ( 5 ) Subjects must express one ( ) follow Human Leukocyte Antigens ( HLA ) : HLADRB1*0101 , HLADRB1*0301 , HLADRB1*0401 , HLADRB1*0405 , HLADRB1*0701 , HLADRB1*0901 , HLADRB1*1001 , HLADRB1*1101 , HLADRB1*1301 , HLADRB1*1401 , HLADRB5*0101 . ( 6 ) Methacholine provocative concentration cause 20 % fall FEV1 ( PC20 ) > 0.125 mg/ml < 16 mg/mL . ( 7 ) Development early asthmatic response ( ≥20 % fall FEV1 ) without late phase asthmatic response screen whole lung allergen challenge . ( 8 ) Willing able provide write informed consent . ( 9 ) The subject must willing able comply study requirement . ( 10 ) If subject female childbearing potential must practice acceptable form contraception , produce negative urine pregnancy test Screening Visit Days 27 1 . A female subject may include without negative urine pregnancy test document surgically sterile least 2 year postmenopausal . ( 11 ) Normal chest Xray within 1 year screen period EXCLUSION CRITERIA 1 ) A history anaphylaxis cat allergen . ( 2 ) Subjects FEV1 < 70 % predict FEV1/FVC ratio < 70 . ( 3 ) Receipt allergen immunotherapy within last 10 year . ( 4 ) Use inhale nasal corticosteroid regular antihistamine use regular medication manage asthma . ( 5 ) Subjects administration epinephrine contraindicate ( e.g . subject acute chronic symptomatic coronary heart disease severe hypertension ) . ( 6 ) Subjects treat betablockers . ( 7 ) Symptoms clinically relevant illness , Investigator 's opinion , within 6 week prior Screening Visit . ( 8 ) Female subject pregnant , lactate plan pregnancy study . ( 9 ) Any clinically relevant abnormality detect physical examination . ( 10 ) Vital sign ( blood pressure , pulse rate , respiratory rate , body temperature ) outside normal limit , unless abnormality consider clinical relevance Investigator . ( 11 ) Laboratory value ( haematology , biochemistry , urine test ) outside normal range , unless abnormality consider clinical relevance Investigator . ( 12 ) History alcohol drug abuse opinion Principal Investigator could significantly affect outcome study . ( 13 ) History immunopathological disease may confound study outcome . ( 14 ) History vasovagal reaction last 10 year associated venipuncture . ( 15 ) Received treatment investigational drug within 3 month prior study . ( 16 ) Unable communicate understand requirement study , would impair communication subject Investigator thereby interfere informed consent procedure gathering study data . ( 17 ) A history significant disease disorder ( e.g . autoimmune , cardiovascular , pulmonary , gastrointestinal , liver , renal , neurological , musculoskeletal , endocrine , metabolic , neoplastic/malignant , psychiatric , major physical impairment , severe atopic dermatitis ) , opinion Investigator , may either put subject risk participation study , influence result study , subject 's ability participate study . ( 18 ) Positive test result Hepatitis B , Hepatitis C , HIV would anticipate follow vaccination history tuberculosis . ( 19 ) Asthma exacerbation lower respiratory tract infection past 6 week . ( 20 ) Subject donate blood ( include blood product ) experience loss blood ≥ 500 mL within 2 month study screen ( 21 ) Subject regularly use nicotine tobacco containing product ( include limit : snuff , chew tobacco , cigar , cigarette , pipe , nicotine patch ) 12 month enrollment/randomization study . A subject former smoker smoke > 10 pack year must exclude . ( 22 ) Subject unwilling avoid rigorous exercise caffeinated beverage least 4 hour study visit .
